snippet: Shaul Mofaz, now a deputy to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, opposes any rush into military action.
abstract: Shaul Mofaz, new leader of Israel's centrist Kadima Party, denounces the government's Iran-centric defense policy, saying it has adversely affected the peace process with the Palestinians; Mofaz, who is Iranian-born, is seen by many as a welcome counterbalance to the more hawkish policies of Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu and his defense minister, Ehud Barak.
lead_paragraph: Shaul Mofaz, now a deputy to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, opposes any rush into military action.

headline.seo: Shaul Mofaz Broadens Israel Coalition’s Views on Iran
headline.main: New Israel Partner Offers Moderate Voice on Iran
headline.print_headline: New Partner Offers Moderate Voice on Iran
